messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

Files containing the handler implementation for App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\UserController@update

- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserController.php

Explanation and notes
- I searched the repository for the Api V1 UserController and opened the controller file. The update(...) method implementation is in app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserController.php.
- The update method:
  - Is declared as public function update(UsersRequest $request, User $user): UserResource
  - Calls $this->authorize('update', $user) (so the UserPolicy is used for authorization)
  - If a password is provided, hashes it via Hash::make and merges it into the request
  - Updates the user with the filtered input (name, email, password)
  - Returns a UserResource for the updated user
- For completeness, the handler depends on (related files used by the implementation):
  - app/Http/Requests/UsersRequest.php (form request used for validation/authorization)
  - app/Models/User.php (the route-model-bound User model)
  - app/Http/Resources/User.php (the API resource returned)
  - app/Policies/UserPolicy.php (authorization for update)
- The route mapping you provided (routes/api.php) points to this controller class for the PUT/PATCH /v1/users/{user} endpoint; the concrete update implementation is the method in the controller file listed above.

files.description: List of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations.
